metadata.title: CVE-2021-45868 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 5.15.3, fs/quota/quota_tree.c does not validatethe block number in the quota tree (on disk). This can, for example, leadto a kernel/locking/rwsem.c use-after-free if there is a corrupted quotafile.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-45868` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1034-dell300x - 4.15.0-1034.39
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1061-gke - 5.4.0-1061.64~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1032-gkeop - 5.4.0-1032.33~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1102.109
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1119-snapdragon - 4.15.0-1119.128
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-167.175').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
